file_content.text: No more. Let the destruction end now.
I believed the information in the Czerka archives had prepared me for this confrontation. I was mistaken.
My species, too, once manipulated the Force. Your Empire, your Sith--you have made life's own energy into a crude and potent weapon. I acknowledge my defeat.
I think I deserve some credit for beating you.
It wasn't just the Sith.
You are not Sith, and so I acknowledge this.
Your Empire is not the house of mindlessness that Czerka was. Even with your primitive technology, you have shown skill. I acknowledge my defeat.
It was the power of the dark side that crushed your minions.
Sith strength beat you!
Yes. Your power in the Force was an unexpected factor.
Your brutality astonishes even me. You have used crude and primitive weapons in ways I had not expected. I acknowledge my defeat.
You want to say anything else before I destroy you?
Any last words?
A final offer.
Surrender yourself and the artifacts.
Give up, then.
You doubted my power, and now you pay the price.
You were a fool to fight me.
It is a mistake I have made before, perhaps, when my people trapped me long ago.
Give up your secrets to me.
I'll rip away your might!
You speak clearly--and you speak, I think, of reasoned action.
It would be pointless for you to end my existence when we can do much for one another.
Bring me to your masters--I will aid them in my surrender. I will reward you with technology your kind has never seen.
We've conquered the galaxy; we'll conquer you.
The Empire always wins.
In this day, in this time, you are correct.
"Primitive" weapons can pack a real kick.
I smashed you pretty bad, huh?
Yes. A truth that has become clear to me, now.
My fate--the fate of the Infinite Empire--is now within your control. You might destroy my prison, and end my eons-long existence.
But bring me to your masters, instead--I shall aid them in my surrender. I will reward you with technology your kind has never seen.
I'll spare you in return for your service. Be grateful.
Very well. For the Empire.
I welcome this illuminating experience. Take what you will, and let us leave.
You've lived too long already.
You're dangerous. [Destroy box]
I deny this. The whiteness will protect me. The Infinite Empire will be reborn....
You will join us now. You will be one with true majesty.
Come to me. Come close, until we are one.
I am the Imprisoned One. Few beings have the strength to resist us... but you have earned my respect. We may share words.
You called yourself the "Imprisoned One"?
About your name...
My true name is lost. The epithet is all I remember.
You're a strange creature.
Sharing is for the weak. I take what I need.
"Share words"? Pitiful.
You should learn to appreciate these exchanges. They are rare and pleasurable.
I am Sith; you are an abomination. We are not equals.
You "respect" me? Foul thing.
Sith. Czerka knows of you. You toy with the Force. My species mastered it.
You seem reasonable. I can work with that.
Okay. Let's talk...
You are clever, sentient. I am glad we have this chance to speak.
Shame I don't have a holodisruptor.
Lucky you're just an image.
You would be rid of me so quickly? This saddens me.
I am Rakata--it is the name of my people. Eons ago, our Infinite Empire ruled this world and so many others.
Yet I reached for greater majesty, and my people sealed my mind in this box as punishment. I drifted in whiteness for over twenty thousand years.
Harsh punishment. What were you trying to do?
Why?
I sought to dance among star temples and understand dark time. In truth, I remember little.
Your people trapped you on Tatooine.
That's how you came here?
When your Czerka Corporation found my prison, I touched this world again. I created my skin-vessels and machine-hands.
I find your galaxy wanting. I choose to remake it and to give birth to a new Infinite Empire.
This galaxy already has an Emperor.
That can't happen.
Then I will remake him, as well.
Share your power with me, instead--you'll be rewarded.
Why don't we team up?
You promise only dust and decay. I promise eternity.
Your empire and mine could become allies. Consider the possibilities.
We might work out a treaty.
No. A star cannot befriend a grain of sand.
I've met a lot of ambitious people, but you're a real nutjob.
You are crazy.
Do tell.
My people's technology is superior to your own. And my mind will guide everything.
Such arrogance.
You truly do not comprehend me. I hoped for more.
You will lead our army out of the sands. This world's settlements will fall, and my skin-vessels will proceed to the stars.
Enough! [Attack]
Join my skin-vessels. The time for resistance is over.
Leave us. Now is not your time.
